alert.note: Alert for Broward; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 3:01PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains capable of producing 1 to 2 inches of rainfall with the slow moving thunderstorms over the metro areas of Northeast Broward and Southeast Palm Beach Counties. These rainfall amounts will cause possible flooding due to the grounds being very saturated. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pompano Beach, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Margate, Lighthouse Point, Coconut Creek, Hillsboro Beach, Boca Del Mar, Boca Pointe, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Hillsboro Ranches, Fau South Campus, Sandalfoot Cove, Boca West and Hillsboro Pines. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
